name: Tri-Unity n-Hypercube Generator Axiom
intent: Define the general commutative hypercube structure for an arbitrary set of operators.
domain: Any chosen operator set O \= {O1, O2, ..., Ok} from the MBC primitive and layer families.
axiom: For any pair A,B ∈ O, the 2D face generated by A and B commutes in normal form: NF(A∘B) \= NF(B∘A).
For any finite chain of operators A1, ..., An ∈ O, there exists a unique normal form NF\_nHYP(A1∘...∘An).
All lower-dimensional structures (Tri-Unity, Tri-Unity+μ, pentacube, etc.) induced by subsets of O embed consistently into the same global normal form NF\_nHYP.
constraints: Rewrite rules must terminate (no infinite ↦ chains).
Normal form is confluent: different rewrite paths yield the same NF\_nHYP.
Meta-operators (\[A,B\], {A,B}, ⊕, ⊗, ⋆, ⇒, ↦) are interpreted so as to preserve the commutative hypercube structure.
